tickets.title: Property Planner Shell UI
tickets.description: Lay down the dedicated property planner workspace UI (launcher, modal/page shell, tabbed navigation) using mocked data so users can evaluate flows before backend integration.
technicalDetails: Add the Property Planner launcher entry point and open a full-screen modal/page with sidebar + header actions.
Implement segmented controls/tabs for HDB, Condo, Landed calculators that swap their content panes without routing.
Stub shared scenario summary panels (cash, CPF, loan, valuation) using deterministic mock data file so UI can render realistic cards.
Provide disabled Apply/Save actions with explanatory tooltips noting backend integration is pending.
Ensure shell is responsive and accessible (keyboard focus trap inside modal, aria labels).
acceptanceCriteria: Users can open/close the planner and switch between property types with instantly updating content panes.
UI renders placeholder summaries/tables so user testing can cover the full flow even without backend data.
Apply/Save buttons exist but stay disabled or show a toast explaining backend work is pending.
No backend/network calls are required; mocks drive all display state.
Design matches product specs (spacing, typography) and passes accessibility smoke checks.

tickets.title: Property Planner Shell Integration
tickets.description: Connect the property planner shell to real data: shared scenario schema, persistence, and apply-to-plan flows that sync with existing assets/liabilities.
technicalDetails: Define shared scenario interfaces (cash events, CPF events, loan schedule, valuation series) in `financialPlan` types.
Persist draft scenarios via Zustand + backend endpoints so users can save per property type and reload later.
Implement Apply/Save actions that call the backend, normalize responses, and merge into assets, liabilities, and cashflow stores.
Handle reconciliation with existing property assets (update vs create) and re-trigger projection recalculation.
Add optimistic UI with rollback on failure plus toast/error handling.
acceptanceCriteria: Scenario drafts survive reloads (local + backend) and are scoped per property type.
Applying a scenario creates/updates the relevant property asset, loan liability, and cashflow entries in the plan.
Projection timeline reflects the newly applied scenario without manual refresh.
Conflicts (e.g., property already in plan) prompt users to overwrite/duplicate before proceeding.
All API calls are typed, tested, and documented in the specs/go-service guide.

tickets.title: HDB Calculator UI
tickets.description: Design the BTO/resale HDB calculator interface (forms, timeline table, warnings) using mock outputs so usability can be validated pre-backend.
technicalDetails: Create multi-step or sectioned form inputs for BTO vs resale (price presets, grants, timeline, financing).
Render yearly timeline rows/cards showing cash, CPF, loan, valuation using fixture data.
Add MSR/TDSR visual indicators (badges, meters) based on client-side calculations with stubbed ratios.
Provide loan toggle UI (HDB vs Bank) that swaps out payment summaries using mock numbers.
Document all data needs (fields, validation) to guide the backend calculator ticket.
acceptanceCriteria: Switching between BTO/resale updates visible sections/fields immediately without reload.
Timeline table/cards show at least 5 years of mock data with the expected columns (cash, CPF, loan balance, valuation).
Affordability badges update in real time as users change income/debt fields (based on client-side math).
Loan comparison UI reacts to selections and surfaces a breakdown (principal vs interest, total monthly).
Developers can demo the full flow end-to-end using mocks, with clear notes on which values are placeholders.

tickets.title: HDB Calculator Engine & Persistence
tickets.description: Implement the real HDB calculator logic (grants, CPF usage, MSR/TDSR, amortization) and wire it to the backend so UI outputs replace the mocks.
technicalDetails: Build calculation services covering BTO progressive payments, resale completion timelines, CPF OA usage limits, and grants.
Implement MSR/TDSR computation using income + debt inputs and return structured warnings for the UI.
Generate amortization schedules for HDB vs bank loans (principal/interest, insurance/taxes/S&CC) on a yearly basis.
Emit structured scenario payload (cash events, CPF events, loan schedule, valuation) consistent with shell schema.
Expose APIs/endpoints plus unit tests to persist and retrieve HDB scenarios.
acceptanceCriteria: Given realistic inputs, backend returns deterministic yearly rows matching product formulas.
MSR/TDSR responses include ratio values and severity flags for the frontend to render.
Scenario payload plugs into the shared Apply flow (assets/liabilities/cashflow updates).
API validates inputs (price, grants, CPF balances) and returns actionable error messages.
Automated tests cover BTO vs resale, grant variations, and CPF refund logic on sale.

tickets.title: Condo & Landed Calculator UI
tickets.description: Create the condo/landed UI forms, maintenance inputs, and timeline tables with mocked numbers so stakeholders can review the experience before backend delivery.
technicalDetails: Provide buyer-profile selector (citizenship, property count) that visually drives ABSD/LTV badges using precomputed values.
Add sections for loan terms, maintenance costs, rental assumptions, and (for landed) land/reno reserves.
Display yearly timeline rows/cards with mock data highlighting mortgage paydown, maintenance, and valuation.
Support rental-income toggles that show offsets in the cash summary using fake data.
Keep Apply disabled + label to indicate backend dependency, mirroring the shell behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: Switching between condo and landed tabs changes the form fields and mock timeline data accordingly.
ABSD/LTV badges update based on buyer profile selections instantly (client-side calculations).
Timeline includes maintenance and rental rows so testers can understand the eventual breakdown.
UI handles edge cases like multiple renovation tranches or rental vacancy toggles purely on the frontend.
Mocks/documentation clearly outline which values will come from the backend later.

tickets.title: Condo & Landed Calculator Engine
tickets.description: Deliver backend calculators for condo and landed properties (ABSD/LTV logic, amortization, maintenance/reserve scheduling) that feed the shared scenario payload.
technicalDetails: Implement ABSD and LTV computations keyed off citizenship and property-count inputs, returning cash vs CPF splits.
Support flexible loan terms (fixed/floating, lock-in, refinance) and produce amortization schedules with yearly summaries.
Model maintenance, sinking fund, property tax, rental income, and vacancy assumptions as recurring cashflow events.
For landed scenarios, ingest land-size + renovation budgets and emit staged cash events (e.g., foundation, TOP).
Expose persistence endpoints/tests so condo/landed scenarios can be saved, retrieved, and applied.
acceptanceCriteria: Backend returns accurate ABSD/LTV outputs that match MAS guidelines for each buyer profile.
Yearly payload includes mortgage, maintenance, rental offsets, and valuation for integration with the UI tables.
Rental assumptions change the net cashflow numbers and generate corresponding income events.
Applying the scenario updates assets/liabilities/cashflow consistently with the shared schema.
Test coverage spans citizen/PR/foreigner profiles, multiple-property ownership, and landed reserve schedules.

tickets.title: Property Timeline Visualization UI
tickets.description: Implement the timeline scrubber, charts, and recommendation card UI using mock scenario data so user research can validate the multi-year storytelling.
technicalDetails: Build a timeline scrubber or slider that highlights a selected year and syncs with detail panels.
Render stacked bar/line charts (cash vs CPF vs loan vs valuation) powered by mock datasets.
Add warning/recommendation cards with placeholder copy and icons triggered off mock flags.
Provide export/snapshot buttons that currently just download the mock JSON/CSV for usability testing.
Ensure components are reusable across property types and responsive down to tablet.
acceptanceCriteria: Selecting a year updates the detail panel immediately using mocked values.
Charts display the four key metrics and animate/transition smoothly on selection changes.
Warning cards appear for mock risk scenarios (cash shortfall, CPF depletion) with explanatory copy.
Export produces a deterministic mock file so UX testing can verify format expectations.
No backend dependency exists; data is mocked yet structured to mirror the final API shape.

tickets.title: Property Timeline Data & Guidance Engine
tickets.description: Back the visualization with real scenario data, computed guidance, and comparison exports so the UI can drop mocks and surface actionable insights.
technicalDetails: Aggregate cash/CPF/loan/valuation streams from each property scenario into yearly buckets consumable by the visualization components.
Compute derived metrics (peak cash usage, CPF trough, break-even year, payback period) and flag thresholds for warnings.
Implement recommendation logic (e.g., extend loan tenure, increase cash buffer) tied to the derived metrics.
Enable snapshot/export API that returns structured CSV/JSON for selected scenarios.
Ensure data endpoints are performant and cached, given the multi-year payload size.
acceptanceCriteria: Visualization consumes live data with no code changes (API matches mock schema).
Warning/recommendation flags originate from backend logic and stay consistent across sessions.
Exports contain the exact data shown in the UI (selected scenario, years, metrics).
Performance benchmarks show data loads under productâ€™s latency target (e.g., <300ms server processing).
Unit/integration tests cover metric calculations and snapshot formatting.
